page.title: 07Hobbies in west: FINTRY
page.content:
{Pigkeeping and spinning}are not usually associated hobbies, but they can be and are! From the raw fleece (of sheep not pigs), through carding the wool, spinning then washing, then knitting into a pullover or cardigan is a very lengthy process. So, to pass the time, keep a pig, or to be more accurate a sow. In the course of time, with luck will come anything up to 13 piglets which in turn will go to market, the sow to a boar and so on. From the standard {Landrace or Large {White}we have now moved into rare breeds ie{Tamworth}and one or two small litters. By this time the jersey or cardigan has been reknitted.
The pigs, like spinning and knitting, can never be commercially viable. They are truly hobbies. (It's true, I've seen it - Editor)
